item.title: 摩根大通称甲骨文在大举押注人工智能债务后 "大显身手
item.description: 甲骨文公司积极的人工智能支出计划让这家云计算巨头的公司债券成为了华尔街寻找人工智能热潮裂缝的焦点。【原文：Oracle Corp.’s aggressive artificial intelligence spending plan has put the cloud computing giant’s corporate bonds under a harsh spotlight as Wall Street searches for cracks in the AI boom.】

item.title: 美联储威廉姆斯称货币政策已为 2026 年做好准备
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行行长约翰-威廉姆斯（John Williams）表示，继上周降息之后，明年的货币政策已做好准备，但就业风险增加，通胀风险略有减弱。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of New York President John Williams said monetary policy is well positioned for next year following last week’s interest-rate reduction, amid increased risks to employment and somewhat-lessened inflation risk.】

item.title: 战略在过去一周再次买入近 10 亿美元比特币

item.title: 特斯拉股价一年来首次创纪录
item.description: 特斯拉公司股价周一延续涨势，最高攀升4.9%，有望自2024年12月以来首次收于历史新高，打破了人们对该公司估值飙升的日益担忧。【原文：Tesla Inc. shares extended a rally climbing as much as 4.9% Monday and are on pace to close at an all-time high for the first time since December 2024, defying growing concerns about the company’s soaring valuation.】

item.title: 激励措施助推美国住宅建筑商信心回升
item.description: 美国住宅建筑商的信心在 12 月份有所上升，因为建筑商继续采取销售激励措施来刺激购房者。【原文：Confidence among US homebuilders edged up in December as builders continued to deploy sales incentives to motivate buyers.】

item.title: 象牙海岸债券上涨，惠誉评级使其接近非洲IG地位

item.title: 美国股市反弹，科技股反弹，交易员等待关键数据
item.description: 周一美国股市反弹，原因是科技股从本周的低迷中卷土重来，交易商也为延迟公布的经济数据做好了准备。【原文：US stocks rallied on Monday as technology stocks staged a comeback from a sluggish week and traders readied themselves for delayed economic data.】

item.title: 美联储争论不休，短期限国债领涨
item.description: 国债小幅上涨，原因是投资者关注本周一系列推迟发布的美国经济报告，这些报告有可能改变美联储明年进一步降息的预期。【原文：Treasuries posted small gains as investors looked to a swath of delayed US economic reports ahead this week that have the potential to alter expectations for further Federal Reserve interest-rates cuts next year.】

item.title: 奥迪仅在中国销售的 E5 Sportback 车型引发欧洲买家的羡慕之情
item.description: 奥迪在中国推出的一系列新车型在欧洲备受关注，车迷们对电动 E5 Sportback 的精致设计和一流性能翘首以盼。【原文：A new line of China-exclusive Audi models is garnering interest in Europe, with car enthusiasts eying the sophisticated design and top-notch performance of the electric E5 Sportback.】

item.title: 寒冷天气来袭，美国宣布东北部进入能源紧急状态
item.description: 由于天气寒冷和宾夕法尼亚州一家工业企业 11 月份的停电事故扰乱了取暖燃料市场，美国交通部宣布进入地区紧急状态。【原文：The US Department of Transportation declared a regional emergency as cold weather and a November electrical outage at a Pennsylvania industrial complex disrupt heating-fuel markets.】

item.title: 新兴市场美元债券 ETF 获得 2023 年以来最大收益
item.description: 随着新兴市场的反弹，投资者开始青睐美元债券，两年来投入追踪该资产类别的基金的资金最多。【原文：Investors are gravitating to dollar bonds to ride the rally in emerging-markets, and have poured the most money in two years into a fund tracking the asset class.】

item.title: 希腊欧洲银行计划推出两项与企业贷款挂钩的特别储备金计划
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，欧洲银行（Eurobank SA）正计划进行两项重大的风险转移交易。【原文：Eurobank SA is planning two significant risk transfer transactions, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 尽管国际货币基金组织发出警告，博茨瓦纳领导人仍希望获得德比尔斯公司的控制权
item.description: 博茨瓦纳总统杜马-博科（Duma Boko）重申了控制戴比尔斯公司的计划，回绝了国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）的警告，即钻石市场的长期低迷使这一计划充满风险。【原文：Botswana President Duma Boko reiterated a plan to take control of De Beers, rebuffing a warning from the International Monetary Fund that the diamond market’s prolonged slump makes it a risky undertaking.】

item.title: 美联储主席米兰称 "基本 "通胀接近目标
item.description: 美联储理事斯蒂芬-米兰（Stephen Miran）再次指出，央行的政策立场对经济造成了不必要的限制，并指出了他对通胀的良性展望和劳动力市场的警示信号。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Stephen Miran again argued the central bank’s policy stance is unnecessarily restrictive on the economy, pointing to his benign outlook for inflation and warning signs in the labor market.】

item.title: 欧洲央行警告意大利一次性征税有损投资者信心
item.description: 欧洲中央银行警告意大利说，政府征收一次性税款的倾向造成了不确定性，损害了投资者的信心，并有可能引发法律纠纷。【原文：The European Central Bank warned Italy that the government’s tendency to impose one-off levies creates uncertainty, undermines investor confidence and risks legal disputes.】

item.title: 随着 Perimeter 首次发行垃圾债券，早期 M&A 基金浪潮渐起
item.description: 美国消防化学品生产商 Perimeter Solutions Inc. 正在加入越来越多的公司行列，急于在债券市场上获得廉价的并购融资。【原文：Perimeter Solutions Inc., a US firefighting chemical producer, is joining the growing list of companies hurrying to the bond market for cheap M&A funding.】

item.title: 动物保健公司 Zoetis 发行 17.5 亿美元可转换债券
item.description: 动物药品公司 Zoetis Inc. 正寻求通过出售可转换债券筹集 17.5 亿美元。【原文：Zoetis Inc., an animal medicine company, is seeking to raise $1.75 billion in a convertible bond sale.】

item.title: 欧盟称中国开始发放稀土通用许可证
item.description: 欧盟最高贸易官员表示，中国已开始发放期限更长的许可证，允许欧洲公司获得对清洁技术、汽车制造商和国防承包商等行业至关重要的关键矿产。【原文：China has started granting licenses with lengthier terms to allow European companies to obtain critical minerals essential for industries including clean tech, automakers and defense contractors, the EU’s top trade official said.】

item.title: 全球钾肥市场对美国结束对白俄罗斯制裁的举动不以为然
item.description: 全球钾肥市场和钾肥的主要生产商基本上对美国决定解除对世界主要供应商之一的制裁置之不理，这表明阻碍钾肥流通的障碍可能会持续存在。【原文：The global potash market — and key producers of the fertilizer — largely shrugged off a US decision to lift sanctions on one of the world’s major suppliers, showing obstacles to flows are likely to persist.】

item.title: 土耳其据称酝酿提高对冲基金投资门槛
item.description: 据熟悉讨论情况的人士透露，在上个月的市场动荡之后，土耳其官员正在考虑采取新措施，大幅提高散户投资者将现金投入对冲基金的门槛。【原文：Turkish officials are considering new measures to sharply raise the bar for retail investors seeking to pile cash into hedge funds after market upheaval last month, according to people familiar with the discussions.】

item.title: 加拿大通胀率稳定在 2.2%，核心指标有所放缓
item.description: 上个月，加拿大的通货膨胀率保持稳定，而核心指标则普遍降温，因为食品和其他一些商品价格的加速上涨被服务价格增长的放缓所抵消。【原文：Inflation in Canada held steady last month while core measures broadly cooled, as accelerating price increases for food and some other goods were offset by slowing services price growth.】

item.title: 订单停滞不前，纽约工厂活动意外萎缩
item.description: 由于订单停滞和出货量减少，纽约州的工厂活动在经历了两个月的稳健增长后，12 月份意外萎缩。【原文：New York state factory activity unexpectedly shrank in December after two solid months of growth as orders stalled and shipments retreated.】

item.title: 欧洲财产保险协会（EIOPA）称德国保险公司持有 1,080 亿美元流动性不足的债务
item.description: 一家顶级监管机构在一份迄今为止最详尽的关于该行业私人信贷投资的报告中称，德国保险公司是欧洲受流动性差的公司债券影响最大的。【原文：German insurers are the most exposed in Europe to illiquid corporate bonds, a top watchdog said in one of the most detailed reports to date on the industry’s investments in private credit.】

item.title: 右翼选举大获全胜，智利股市再创新高
item.description: 极端保守派人士何塞-安东尼奥-卡斯特（José Antonio Kast）以压倒性优势赢得总统大选，预示着智利数十年来最引人注目的右倾化，智利股市周一早盘创下新纪录，比索也升至14个月高点附近。【原文：Chilean stocks hit a fresh record in early trading on Monday and the peso held near a 14-month high after ultra-conservative José Antonio Kast won the presidency by a landslide, heralding the nation’s most dramatic rightward shift in decades.】

item.title: 印度官员称俄罗斯石油进口将因更严格的检查而减少
item.description: 印度官员表示，在加强检查以确保遵守西方的限制措施后，他们预计本月从俄罗斯进口的石油将降至每天 80 万桶。【原文：Indian officials said they expect oil imports from Russia will drop to 800,000 barrels a day this month, after they tightened checks to ensure compliance with Western curbs.】

item.title: AQR 携 1,790 亿美元资产卷土重来，并对保密工作情有独钟
item.description: AQR 资本管理公司（AQR Capital Management）再次高歌猛进，各项策略均位居基准之首，资产增长速度创下历史新高。不过，在卷土重来的过程中，这家量化先锋公司收敛了一项曾使其成为对冲基金中异类的政策：在解释其投资方式时，采用了一种异常开放的方法。【原文：AQR Capital Management is riding high again, topping benchmarks across strategies and growing assets at a record pace. In the process of engineering a comeback, however, the quant pioneer has reined in a policy that once made it an outlier among hedge funds: An unusually open approach to explaining how it invests.】

item.title: Braskem 所有者 Novonor 和 IG4 推进股权出售交易
item.description: 陷入困境的企业集团诺沃诺公司（Novonor SA）即将达成一项交易，将其在石化巨头巴西石油公司（Braskem SA）的控股权出售给资产管理公司 IG4 Capital 顾问的一家基金。【原文：Troubled conglomerate Novonor SA is closer to a deal to sell its controlling stake in petrochemical giant Braskem SA to a fund advised by asset manager IG4 Capital.】

item.title: CLO 管理者豪赌收购复兴将在 2026 年提升利润
item.description: 据债务管理公司称，备受瞩目的企业收购活动很可能会蔓延到 2026 年，从而刺激对杠杆融资的需求，据估计，这种需求可能会翻一番。【原文：A flare up in high-profile corporate buyouts is likely to spread into 2026, spurring demand for leveraged financing that could double by some estimates, according to debt managers.】
